value_proposition.summary: Positions itself as a modern, employee-centric public-sector organisation offering a 4-day work week, long-term remote work opportunities from any EU country, strong focus on emotional and physical health, additional health insurance, partially reimbursed lunch, and flexible work arrangements designed to support sustainable workâ€“life balance.

purpose_impact.summary: Frames its purpose around ensuring reliable, efficient and environmentally responsible heat production and infrastructure for Vilnius residents. Emphasises contributions to cleaner energy systems, reduced emissions, and the long-term development of urban energy technologies such as district heating, cooling and modernization projects.

target_talent_profile.summary: Job ads focus on technical and engineering profiles (heat production operators, infrastructure specialists, project managers, building maintenance roles) alongside data engineers and digitalisation professionals. Roles assume domain knowledge in energy, engineering, IT, building systems or operations, with an expectation of independent problem-solving, initiative and responsibility.

company_culture.summary: Describes a value-driven culture built on initiative, accountability and a strong social mission. Emphasises trust, autonomy, supportive and friendly teams, psychological safety, and a consistent focus on well-being. The culture promotes innovation in energy infrastructure, encourages employees to act boldly, and reinforces responsibility toward customers, colleagues and the broader environment.

learning_possibilities.summary: Provides structured professional development, covering mandatory and periodic technical training, with the company funding required certifications. Roles highlight fast professional growth through direct exposure to complex energy technologies, digital platforms such as Microsoft Fabric, and hands-on work with critical city infrastructure. Learning appears practical, technical and role-specific, with less emphasis on formal internal academies.
